line.en: 'You're late!'
Ageha scolded me when I joined everyone again.
'You said you'd come right back, so what were you\ndoing? You're pretty late!'
'Ah, umm... Sorry.'
'...Where's Yoru?'
'Huh? She's not back yet?'
Apparently she'd just run off somewhere.
'Wasn't she with you?'
'On the way back... Ummm, yeah. I had another\nerrand to run, so I asked to go on back without\nme.'
'Hmm. I guess Yoru stopped somewhere along the\nway too.'
Where had Asa gone?
I was worried, so I wanted to look for her,\nbut... If I went to find her...
'Well then, let's stop here for today.'
'Sounds good. It's getting late. We'd better\nhurry home to beat the typhoon.'
'Aah, you're right. We'd better finish up and\ngo.'
'...It'd definitely be bad if we were unable to\nget home.'
'Hmm, Yoru never came back.'
Even when we finished up our club activities for\nthe day, Asa still hadn't returned.
'Well, she always does everything at her own\npace. She probably remembered something she had\nto do and went home.'
'You don't know anything, Aoi?'
'Ah, um, no.'
I tried to figure out how to cover it up.
'She looked a little bit sick, so maybe she went\nhome early.'
So that's how I answered.
'Aah, I see.'
'She definitely wasn't acting like herself,\noffering to help you and stuff...'
'Maybe she was... sick...'
'Hey, Aoi. Did something happen?'
'Huh?'
'No, it's just, I thought maybe you noticed\nsomething, and then something happened... Umm...'
Could it be...
Now that I thought about it, Kanako had been\nacting strange since morning.
And she'd said she had a plan to help out, so\nmaybe she'd started all of this.
'Aaah... Yeah, I noticed. Asa and Yoru, right?'
'Aaah, so you did notice, then. It is you, after\nall.'
'And yeah, something happened...'
Kanako gave a slightly pained-looking smile.
'I'm sorry. This was all my idea.'
'Ah. I thought so.'
It was all Kanako's prank.
Apparently this was her way of helping.
I'm not sure how getting the twins to switch\nplaces was supposed to help, but maybe she was\njust trying to cheer them up with something fun.
'But I think the fact that Asa's not here...\ndoesn't really have much to do with that.'
'Huh? Really?'
'Yeah. That is, something really did happen...'
'...Hmmm... I'm kinda worried, but it seems like\nit might be better not to ask...'
'Yeah... It's a little hard to explain...'
'Ooooh... kay then. I see. I'll try not to ask\ntoo much.'
She looked a little unsatisfied, but whether or\nnot she'd guessed what had happened, Kanako\nagreed not to push the issue.
Usually, I'd like to explain what was going on to\nKanako... But I couldn't this time.
'I hope...Yoru... is back in her room.'
'Yeah.'
I kept an eye out for Asa on the way home.
I hoped she was already back there, but if not...
'Um, Aoi.'
'...Yeah?'
'...Did something happen?'
Still pretending to be Asa, Yoru was definitely\nworried about her older sister.
Yoru was pretty sharp, and seemed to have guessed\nthat something was going on.
'Something?'
'Did something happen between you and Yoru?'
...Looking at her like this, I really couldn't\ntell the difference.

If I listened very closely to her voice and way
of speaking, I could tell, but if I was only
looking at her pretending to be Asa, it was easy
to ignore the slight sense that something was
off.
'Nothing happened.'
'...You're lying.'
'Why do you think so?'
'Because you look like you're hiding something,\nand also, Yoru isn't the type to go home without\nsaying something...'
'At least, without saying something to me.'
It might be better to just blow her cover.
'You're right, Asa's not like that at all.'
'Right, Yoru?'
Yoru looked startled.
She realized that I knew who she really was.
'... Did Sis tell you?'
'I guess you could say that... A lot of stuff\nhappened.'
'...And that's why she's not here now?'
'Mmm...Yeah.'
I wondered if I should tell Yoru what happened.
But no, it was the same as with Kanako...
'Did she tell you she likes you?'
What did Yoru just say?
'That's what your expression seems to imply. It\nlooks like I was right.'
'Well, I never actually confirmed Sis's feelings\ndirectly, so that was just a guess too.'
I was really impressed by Yoru's skills of\ndeduction.
But they were twins, after all. Yoru must have\nnoticed Asa's feelings.
'She didn't exactly tell me her feelings. But it\nwas kind of like that...'
'I think I have a pretty good guess. A general\none.'
'I see. Huh... So that's what Sis did.'
'She must have been in a hurry.'
'Huh?'
In a hurry? Asa? What for?
'Aoi. Can I ask you something dumb?'
'Something dumb?'
'...Never mind.'
'...What is it? If there's something you want to\nsay...'
'No, it's nothing. Really.'
...Yoru?
What was she trying to say?
We arrived back at Flying Fish Manor, but Asa\nwasn't there.
Where could she be...?
I was starting to hear the wind blowing hard\noutside the windows.
The sun hadn't yet set, but it was already dark\noutside, and it looked like the storm could start\nat any moment.
'Can you think of where she might be?'
'We just came back from all the places I could\nthink to look.'
Of course.
We'd come back to Flying Fish Manor from the\nsecret base, by way of Windmill Hill.
We'd already been to the places where we could\nexpect to find Asa.
'Yeah?'
'Sis has what I don't. And I can trust her.\nThat's why...'
'That's why...'
Yoru?
Is she struggling about whether or not to say\nsomething?
What could she be trying to say?
'...You'd better not turn my sister down.'
'...At any rate, we've got to prepare for the\ntyphoon. I haven't put the shutters up on all the\nwindows yet.'
'...I'll help.'
Clatter clatter
The windows were rattling, making noises that\nwere bad for the heart.

Flying Fish Manor was an old wooden building, and
rough wind made it shake so hard it was almost
comical. Inside, we couldn't help but worry that
it would break down.
'Hmm... I guess it's finally hit, now, right?'
According to the news, this was right when the\nroughest part of the storm was supposed to reach\nus.
The wind and rain outside had both grown\nstronger.
'But is this dorm really safe...?'
'I've just reinforced all the places that looked\nlike they needed it, so it should be fine.'
My experience from the last typhoon helped, too.
I put up boards over the thin glass doors to\nprotect them.
Dinner was ready, and now all we had to do was\neat it together and wait for the storm to pass.\nBut...
'...Sis still isn't back.'
Asa still hadn't returned.
'Can you get through to her phone?'
'She's turned it off. She sent one mail, that\njust said to eat without her.'
'...I'll go look for her.'
'Now?! The storm's coming!!'
'That's why I've gotta go now. Yoru might not be\nable to get back by herself.'
'I don't think you have so much to worry about...\nShe probably just went somewhere on a whim.'
'No, I think...'
'You said she looked sick, too. ...Ah, maybe she\nwent to the hospital?'
'A, anyway, I'm worried because she hasn't\ncontacted us, so I'll go look for her!'
'Aoi, are you hiding something...?'
'Something seems strange.'
'It's nothing!'
And it would take too long to explain. I didn't\nhave time now.
'Then I'll come too.'
'No, Asa, you wait here. Kanako, can I borrow\nyour bicycle?'
'Huh? Uh, yeah.'
'That's why. If we walk, it'll take too long, and\nif you ride with me it'll slow me down too.\nOkay?'
'I can handle this wind. And I can't just leave\nthis up to you girls.'
'There you go again, Aoi. Being the big boy.'
'Shut up.'
'...I see.'
'So I've gotta go. Kanako, I need the key.'
'Okay, I'll go get it, so wait just a minute.'
'Do you have any idea of where to look?'
'Just a guess. If she's not there, I'll go around\nonce more and then come straight back.'
'Uh, um, Aoi...I...'
'Yeah?'
'I'm counting on you. To find Yoru.'
'... Right!'
'If it gets dangerous, come straight home, okay?'
'Yeah, I'll do that. Don't worry.'
So I rode down the road to go find Asa.
I had a guess as to where she'd gone.
I'd had a similar experience myself.
One time when I was very young, I'd gotten in a\nfight with my parents, and even though it was\nalready night, I went out wandering through town.
I didn't have anywhere in particular to go, but I\njust didn't want to see my parents' faces, so I\nwalked all over.
At first I wanted to go to my favorite park, but\nI figured my parents would expect to find me\nthere, so I went somewhere else.
But finally I went to that park after all. I\nwaited until my parents had probably already\nchecked there, and when there in the end.
Eventually they came back to the park and found\nme anyway... But that's not the point.
When people are upset or uneasy, they tend to\ngravitate to places that make them feel\ncomfortable. That's how I felt.
And in the midst of this storm, it was likely\nthat she'd want to be somewhere she could stay\nwithout imposing, safe inside.
So she should be...
'So you were here, after all.'
She was just where I'd expected her.
She'd waited until we'd gone home, and then came\nback here.
'How did you...'
'I figured this is where you'd come.'
I couldn't think of anywhere else to look.
A place inside, where Asa could be alone and feel\nsafe.
'...The storm's already coming. It's dangerous.\nCan we go home?'
Asa looked away from me with a guilty expression.
'I'm not worried about that.'
'...But Yoru.'
'I don't know how to face Yoru... I was\npretending to be her when I did it.'
'It's okay. I knew it was you already. I was\nsurprised, but...'
'It's not okay!'
Asa suddenly shouted.
She looked startled to hear her own voice so\nloud, and clasped her hands over her mouth.
'I'm... not okay... Because, because... I...'
'I... don't know how to face Yoru. I'd noticed\nhow she felt, but...'
'You'd noticed what?'
Asa surprised me by raising her voice again.
...Asa?
'I like you, Aoi.'
She... confessed to me...
I'd already realized it when she kissed me, but I\nstill felt a twinge when she said it out loud.
'I'm really not sure when it started, but at some\npoint I fell for you.'
'Once I realized how I felt, I couldn't stop it.\nBut I also knew.'
'It wasn't just me who felt that way about you.'
Not just Asa?
Who liked me?
'Wh, what do you mean...?'
I was confused by Asa's unexpected announcement.
Someone other than Asa... also liked me?
'And she's so much more amazing than me. I even\nthink you'd be so much better off with her.'
'But when I think about it that way, I get so\nconfused. So I asked you.'
'What you thought about me... and her.'
...Could she me... No...
'What do you think of me, Aoi?'
'And what do you think of Sis?'
'Yoru likes you too! So I thought, you should\ndate Yoru.'
'So I thought I should kiss you, as Yoru, and\njust leave it at that - that you and Yoru\nkissed.'
'I didn't really know what I was doing, but I did\nit. But! It was me who kissed you!'

'...But of course that wouldn't make Yoru happy
at all, and I still had my own feelings for you,
and... It hurt so much to hear that you thought
of me like a sister, and I... I...'
'(hic) I- I don't know what's going on. I'm just\nso upset, and I did something so awful, and...\n(hic)'
'Even though everyone else was working so hard, I\nwas only thinking about you, just selfishly\nthinking my own thoughts instead of joining in.'
'And then I caused even more trouble today. And I\nmade you come out in the middle of this storm\njust to find me...'
'I... I... Why am I always this horrible,\nawful... Why... Uwaaaaaaahhhh!!!'
Asa broke down sobbing.
She was so sensitive.
She just wasn't very good at... living.
I sensed a weak side of her, like a baby that\ncouldn't control itself.
'But Asa. If you just stay here crying by\nyourself in the storm, you'll just make everyone\nworried.'
I stepped closer to Asa, and wrapped my arm\naround her back.
'So we've got to go home.'
'Unnnghh... Nnnmmnn...'
Asa seemed even more fragile than I'd thought.
Even more than I'd imagined.
'Let's just go home, Asa. The storm's getting\nworse.'
I took the trembling Asa with me, and returned\nhome to Flying Fish Manor.
'You're late, Asa.'
When we got back to Flying Fish Manor, the two of\nthem were waiting for us.
'Here, have a towel.'
'Ah, thank you.'
Kanako handed towels to me and Asa, and we dried\nourselves off.
They'd realized that we'd come home soaking wet.
'You were both waiting for us?'
'We were worried. You said you'd come right back,\nAoi. And besides, we don't want you guys dripping\nall over the floor in here.'
Yoru practically leapt onto Asa in her hurry to\nhug her.
'Yoru?!'
'I was so worried! The storm was so bad, and you\nhadn't come back! Why would you do something like\nthat?! ...Uwaah...'
'...I'm sorry... Yoru... I'm sorry...'
'Uuuuuunnngh...!'
'So what happened? Asa's eyes look red.'
'A lot of things.'
'Hmmm. Well anyway, I'm hungry, so let's eat.\nEveryone's waiting.'
'Eh? You didn't eat without us?'
'Dinner tastes better when you eat it all\ntogether!'
I see.
'...Thank you.'
'Hm? We haven't done anything you need to thank\nus for.'
'...And besides, this all started because of my\nmeddling in the first place.'
'...That might actually be the case...'
'So we're all even.'
Kanako smiled ironically.
'I really am sorry, Yoru...'
Yoru liked me too. If what Asa said was true.
What should I do now?
I was the type who usually just adjusted to other\npeople's opinions.
Because I had no self confidence. And I was\nafraid, more than anything, of people hating me.
The only reason I got decent grades on tests was\nbecause I studied really hard, and tried to\nappear smarter than I was.
I didn't want to look bad to others. I had no\nconfidence that I'd be okay if that happened.
But that was what limited me.
I appeared to have great manners, and to be\nreally cooperative, but that was just a side\neffect of my lack of confidence.
I can't make my own rules like Yoru does, or be\nupfront about what I want like Yoru does, or be\nstrong like Yoru does.

Strangers were jealous of my family's money, and
hated me over things that didn't matter, and I
wasn't strong enough to bounce back from their
hatred.
At home, my own parents laughed at my ineptitude.
And no one, not even a stronger person than I,\ncould ignore those twisted smiles.
I simply wasn't at their level.
The next day.
By morning the typhoon had passed, and calm\nreturned to Kazegaura.
School started at the usual time.
And Soaring Club also carried on as usual.
'It's kinda lonely when we're missing a member.'
Kotori suddenly mumbled her thoughts.
'Yeah, Asa's not here. It's hard to get\ncomfortable.'
'That's right; Asa's the one who softens up the\natmosphere around here. It's just a little too\ntense without her...'
Asa stayed home from both school and club that\nday.
Because of the rain last night, she'd caught a\ncold.
'...Yeah.'
'She's been really trying hard lately. She's been\npracticing a lot on the simulator too. Maybe the\ntyphoon just brought out all her exhaustion.'
'Little Kazato, you shouldn't worry your big\nsister so much, you know? She was really\nconcerned when you went missing last night.'
'...You're right. I'm sorry.'
'Ahaha, but Yoru, going to the bookstore on a\nnight like that? Did you really want a new book\nthat badly?'
'Yes, I did. But the store was closed, so I\ncouldn't get it anyway.'
'Well, yeah, a bookstore wouldn't be open. Not\nduring that typhoon.'
We'd thought it best not to tell Ageha and Kotori\nabout the switch yesterday.
Instead, Yoru said that she'd gone to the\nbookstore to get a book she'd been wanting.
And I said that since I knew she wanted a new\nbook, I'd gone to Windy's to find her.
'From now on, you stay in your room when there's\na typhoon! Since you're living in a dorm, you owe\nit to the rest of us not to worry everyone!'
'...I apologize for what I did yesterday. I'm\nsorry. I'll be careful next time.'
'Ahaha! Please do be careful not to worry us.'
Yoru was doing a great job putting up with all of\nthis.
Even though it wasn't her fault, she was acting\nas though it was, and apologizing to everyone.
'Thank you for yesterday, Aoi.'
'I just wanted to thank you again.'
'I didn't really do anything you need to thank me\nfor. Don't worry about it.'
'I suppose...'
Yoru must have been thanking me for going out to\nfind Asa, but that whole problem was partly my\nfault as well.
There was nothing for her to be concerned about.
'I wonder if Asa's okay.'
'I hope she gets better by tomorrow.'
'...Why don't we get her something on the way\nhome? If she's got a fever, she'd probably like\nsome ice cream.'
'True. I'm sure she'll be happy to get that...'
Hargen Darch might be a good idea.
I still couldn't tell Yoru what I'd heard from\nAsa.
That Yoru liked me.
There was no real need to tell Yoru anyway, and\neven if I did, I don't know what I'd do next.
But for some reason it felt really bad to pretend\nthat I didn't know, even though I did.
'...Should I buy it for her on the way home? I\ncan pretend I bought it with you, and we can give\nit to her together later.'
'Huh? Are you going home already, Yoru?'
'Yes. I'm worried about my sister.'
'I see.'
She had seemed very upset.
'Aoi, why don't you go home a little early?'
'Huh?'
'You're worried too, aren't you? About Asa.'
'Yeah, I am, but what about the club?'
'It's okay. I'll do your share of the work today.\nSo go ahead and check up on her, okay?'
'It's hard for me to say, but I think Asa would\nbe happier to see you than me.'
Kanako had showed up to Soaring again today, and\nnow she was recommending that I go home.
Actually the reason Kanako had given for showing\nup in the first place was to do Asa's share of\nthe work.

'Don't worry about, Aoi. We've made up the loss
from last week, and we can afford to carry on
without you for the rest of the day. Kanako's
here helping too.'
'That's right. And you're in charge of Asa, so\nyou should go back and take care of her.'
'I'm... in charge of her?'
'Well, you two are always together lately. So I\nfigured you were in charge of her at times like\nthis. Right?'
'Umm... I guess. I suppose we are together a\nlot.'
But the words 'in charge' still sounded a little\nstrange.
'Well then. Go back to the dorm with her sister,\nokay?'
I see...
'Besides, if you keep working with your mind\nsomewhere else, you won't get much done here\nanyway. You're worried, right?'
'Ah, err... I...'
It's true that I was worried about Asa, but\nthat's not what I'd been brooding about.
But I couldn't exactly explain, either.
'...Okay. Well then, I'll take your advice and go\nback. Thanks for finishing up here.'
'No problem! Leave it to us!'
'Let's go, Yoru.'
'Eh... Uh, yeah.'
Instead of going straight back to the dorm, we\nheaded to Windy's first to pick up Hargen Darch\nfor Asa.
On the surface, everything seemed normal, but I\ncould tell that things were actually extremely\nuncomfortable as they were.
Yoru likes me.
But was what Asa said really, really true?
After all, Yoru certainly didn't usually act like\nshe liked me.
'Um, Aoi...'
'...Yeah?'
'Is it okay with you? Going shopping together\nwith me.'
'What do you mean? I have nothing against\nshopping with you, Yoru.'
'It doesn't feel uncomfortable to you?'
'I just wondered. You seem to feel that way\ntoday.'
Apparently Yoru was able to tell how confused and\nawkward I felt.
'...It's okay. There's nothing to worry about.\nAnd there's no reason for you to think there is,\nright?'
'Well, okay then.'
'One strawberry, one super-spicy Szechuan\nvanilla, and one chocolate chip, please.'
I ordered one ice cream for each of us.
The chocolate chip was for me, the strawberry for\nYoru, and the super-spicy Szechuan vanilla for\nAsa.
I got the ice cream, and went back to where Yoru\nwas waiting.
'Sorry to keep you waiting. Let's go.'
'Yes.'
After collecting Yoru outside of the shop, we\nheaded for the exit from Windy's. We didn't have\nany other errands, so we were going to go home.
'They make really strange flavors, don't they?'
'You mean super-spicy Szechuan vanilla? Yeah,\nit's pretty crazy.'
'I wonder who even wants this stuff.'
'My sister?'
Oh, right.
Yoru was the one who told me that Asa liked this\nflavor.
'Have you ever eaten it, Yoru?'
'Of course not. Sis recommended it, but I didn't\ntake her up on the offer.'
'I don't blame you.'
I wouldn't want to try it either.
'Sis said it was like a combination of salt and\nvanilla.'
There's no way that could be true.
'She said it was a balance of heat and cold.'
That was... interesting.
It seemed that Asa had a... different point of\nview.
I just remembered, Yoru knew about Asa's feelings\nfor me too.
And if it was true what Asa said, she still liked\nme.
And of course she knew that I knew about Asa's\nfeelings.
I wonder how Yoru felt about being with me now.
Was it uncomfortable?
Thinking of it that way, maybe I was really\nbothering Yoru by walking home with her.
'By the way, Aoi.'
'...Yeah?'
'...What are you going to do about Sis?'
...Yeah, of course she'd be wondering about it.
My response to Asa. My answer.
I had to give an answer to her kiss.
'I like my sister, and I don't want you to do\nsomething that would make her sad.'
'I think she really, truly likes you.'
Asa liked me.
Given how Asa was acting yesterday, I was sure\nthat was true.
So Yoru was telling me that she wanted me to date\nher sister, whom she cared about.
But...
But if I did, what about Yoru?
If Yoru really did like me, like Asa said she\ndid.
And if Asa had really done what she did yesterday\nbecause of knowing about Yoru.
'...That wouldn't be enough for Asa.'
'What do you mean?'
I made up my mind.
Brooding didn't suit me. I'd always preferred to\nmeet problems head on.
I wasn't such a skilled guy that I could take\ncare of everyone's sensitivities, or choose the\nmost discreet course of action.
So I just...
'Aoi?'
'Yoru, what do you think about me?'
'Yesterday, Asa told me that you liked me too.'
'Eeeeh?'
I decided I should just ask.
'That's what I heard from Asa yesterday.'
'...I see... Sis noticed... So that's why she\nasked me that...'
'So Asa's also unsure of what to do. She was so\nconfused, that she went and did what she did...'
'Asa said she thought that you were more suitable\nfor me.'
... Yoru.
Maybe Yoru had been keeping her feelings to\nherself for Asa's sake.
She really did care about her sister.
'...(sigh) That's so like her.'
'Unlike me, she's never sure of herself.'
'...Yeah. I can see that.'
And that's why she did what she did yesterday.
'But I respect her for that. ...Can I say\nsomething a bit conceited, Aoi?'
'Sure?'
'I've never really gone through much hardship. I\nwork hard, but I've never found it to be a\ntrial.'
'So I don't really understand what hardship feels\nlike for most people.'
'I was born with many talents, and to a rich\nhome. I really can do anything. 'Cause I'm a\ngenius.'
'...You really are conceited, Yoru.'
'I said I was going to say something\nconceited...'
'Yes, you did.'
But I didn't think she meant it quite that much.
'She's an average person born to an extraordinary\nfamily. She's totally worthless. That's how my\nrelatives feel about my sister.'
Worthless? Asa?

'She's never been really accepted by our
relatives. Deep down in their hearts, they all
look down on her. She's got such great genes but
she's just average, they think.'

'She's looked down upon by her relatives... And
the others around her are unkind as well. At
school, and in the neighborhood. Because she's
rich, and in a good family. That's what comes
with being rich.'
'Such...'
'Even if she worked herself to the bone and\nmanaged to get top scores on the test, the family\nwould just take it for granted.'
'And for some reason, even her friends are mean\nto her.'
'Sis was born into the wrong world.'
Wow...
I'd known already that rich kids were looked upon\nwith jealousy by the people around them.
I suppose the standards were higher in an\nextraordinary family like theirs.
'...Can we take a slight detour?'
'A detour?'
'Just a little one. I want to go to Windmill Hill\none more time. If we keep up this pace we'll\narrive at the dorm too soon.'
'The ice pack will keep the ice cream from\nmelting right away.'
'I see... Okay.'
We went back the way we'd come, back towards\nWindmill Hill.
'But Sis kept on going, always struggling not to\nbe crushed by all that pressure. She never ran\naway, or became selfish, or complained.'
'I'm talented. My sister is not.'
'So... Don't you think she must have more\nproblems than I do?'
Yoru was unbelievably frank, saying just what she\nthought with no excuses.
She was completely straightforward.
'My sister is strong. She didn't give up, or\ndecide to just let people hate her, or stop\ntrying to make connections with people.'
'She always tries as hard as she can. And I\nreally respect her for it.'
'She lives her life fighting against so many\nobstacles. Desperately struggling to survive.'
'How could I not respect that?'
'I can relax around her. Because she has so many\nthings that I don't.'
'When I'm around her, I don't turn too much into\nmyself...'
'If I'm left alone too long, I grow even more\nconceited.'
Yoru was already much more conceited than I'd\nthought.
And also, perhaps, more mature.
'But I think maybe Sis is a little weaker than I\nthought.'
'Huh?'
'Weaker, and much more human.'
'I knew, of course, that she was a little jealous\nof me. But that's true of every average person.'
'But I never thought she'd let something\nmeaningless like that get in her way.'
'Meaningless...?'
'Yes, it's meaningless. That she might lose to\nme. That I'm better for you. They're all just\nexcuses, right?'
'She wanted something, but couldn't get it,\nbecause she lost the courage to get it herself,\nand she's just sulking about it.'
'That's...'
I suppose that might be a bit true, in Asa's\ncase.
'Alright then.'
Yoru nodded, as though she'd just decided\nsomething.
'What is?'
'If it was okay with you, I was planning to give\nup your love to my sister. But I think I've\nchanged my mind.'
'Aoi, can you look down for just a moment?'
'...Down?'
I did so, and then she squeezed up against me.
And then I felt something warm against my lips.
It was Yoru's lips.
Ba-dump.
I couldn't help but make a noise.
I was confused.
By this unexpected kiss.
By this expression of her feelings.
'...I like you.'
When I looked down, I saw Yoru, standing on her\ntiptoes to kiss me.
And she'd confessed her feelings to me.
'It's true. I like you, Aoi. So I'm telling you\nnow.'
Yoru... confessed... to me?
First Asa, and now Yoru...
'Now it's up to you to decide the course of your\nlove. I think that's how you can help my sister.'
And she gave me a choice.
'You can choose her, or choose me, or turn us\nboth down. Whatever you decide.'
'Aoi, please answer.'
We visited Asa's room, bringing the ice cream.
'Aoi... And Yoru.'
'We're home. How are you feeling, Sis?'
'H, hi. I'm much better. My fever's gone, too.'
'We brought you something.'
'F, for me?'
Asa sounded nervous.
I hadn't seen Asa since dinner last night, after\nI brought her home.
So it was the first time we'd seen each other\nsince she'd confessed her feelings to me.
'...Oh, it's Hargen Darch ice cream! And even\nsuper-spicy Szechuan vanilla!'
'Yoru said you liked that flavor.'
'Th, thank you, Yoru.'
'You're welcome.'
Asa opened the lid of the ice cream, stabbed into\nit with the attached spoon, and brought it to her\nmouth.
'Yeah. It's cold, spicy, and delicious...'
'...B, by the way, aren't... Aren't you early?'
'We were worried about you, and the club seemed\nto be wrapping up pretty quickly, so we came home\na little early.'
'Ah... I caused trouble for everyone again...'
'No, no, no trouble at all.'
'B, but...'
'Listen to him, Sis. You're overthinking it.'
Asa looked troubled.
She must be confused about what was going on.
'Was everyone well today?'
'Yeah. They're all fine.'
'They were all happily working on the glider.\nBut...'
'They were muttering that it felt like something\nwas missing without you there.'
'So hurry up and get better, Sis.'
'...Yeah.'
...Well then.
'Well, I'll be going. As long as I'm home early,\nI may as well work extra hard on tonight's\ndinner.'
'I've gotta make a lot of food to give Asa energy\nso she can get better!'
'Th, thank you, Aoi.'
'Take care of yourself.'
I went back to my room.
Asa would probably be too nervous around me to\nreally rest.
So I decided to eat my ice cream in my own room.
...Or rather, that was my excuse.
'Aoi, please answer.'
The truth was, it was a little hard for me to be\nwith them right now.
It made my stomach hurt, and my chest tighten up.
So... What should I do?
What should I say to them?
Asa, or Yoru.
Twins, and complete opposites.
My precious underclassmen.
I had to give them an answer.
'(I did something very unlike myself.)'
'I wonder why I said that.'
'(I never intended to acknowledge it. I thought\nthese feelings for Aoi, this love, was just my\nimagination.)'
'(These feelings must be...)'
'I feel so much better now that Sis has gone to\nthe bath.'
'(It was so awkward and suffocating... I'm sure\nSis doesn't know yet what I said to him, but...)'
'This is a first for me.'
'(I guess I've got to acknowledge it...)'
I still couldn't think of an answer.
I was still searching for one as I cooked, and\nall through dinner.
And now, as I sat in the bath, I was still\nbrooding.
When was the last time I'd spent so long thinking\nover one thing?
It must have been last year, when I was\nregretting not being able to reach Morning Glory.
...And before that, it was the accident.
'Aaah, this is no good.'
I muttered to myself.
I'm not used to all this brooding.
During dinner, Asa and Yoru and I had only spoken\nto each other two or three times, with just a few\nforced phrases.
...I was so nervous.
Clatter
'(sigh)... It's not good. I still feel like I'm\nsuffocating in my own room. And it's hard to talk\nto Yoru...'
'Uuurgh... I know it's my own fault, but why is\nthis happening to me?'
'Aaaah, I'm so stupid, stupid, stupid!!'
Why is Asa coming in here...?
This was definitely my time to be in the bath,\nand I'd put up a sign on the door.
So... Why...?
'Uuuuunnhh... I hate this type of thing. I've\nalways, ALWAYS hated it! Why was I born so\ndumb?!'
'Waaaaahhh! I can't do anything right at all,\neven though my family's so great! Uunngh,\nwaaah... I just keep making idiotic mistakes!'
'Idiotic... mistakes...'
My clothes were even in the changing area.
How could anyone make... such an idiotic...\nmistake...
'Uwaaaaaaaahhh!! Aoi! Why are you here?!'
'N, no, that's what I want to know! That's my\nline right now! It's my turn to use the bath!'
'Eeeeeh?! R, really?!'
Why was Asa in the bathroom, with me?!
'I, I... I thought I didn't need a bath, so I\nskipped it... But then I felt sweaty so I came\nhere after all...'
'There were clothes out there, right? In the\nchanging area? My clothes!'
'Eh, eh, ah, aaaaaaah, you're right! There were!\nAaah, I was so preoccupied I didn't even\nnotice?!'
C- come on, Asa...?!
'Uh, um...'
'I, I'm sorry!!'
Asa ran out of the bathroom, her face bright red.
I'd been hoping to have a long think in the\nbathtub, but I hadn't been able to think at all.
I never imagined that Asa would accidentally come\ninto the bathroom.
After I got out, I left hot water for Asa and\ntold her the bath was free, so she was probably\nin there now.
My mind kept rewinding the film of Asa trembling,\nbut not quite covering herself.
The image was taking over my whole mind.
This was no good.
I was trying to decide what to do about Asa, but\nall I could do now was picture her naked, and I\ncouldn't think at all.
But I really did need to make a decision. Things\nwere already bad enough as they were!!
But really.
What should I do?
'Oh, I've found a brooding boy!'
Kanako...
'What's up? Out of the bath and in a place like\nthis. Thinking about something?'
'What about you, Kanako? What are you up to?'
'I came to look at the stars. I love stargazing.'
'Hmmm...'
It may be rude of me, but I was surprised to hear\nthat.
'The sky is wonderful. This may not be the same\ncolor as the sky you guys are aiming for, but I\nlove the sky too.'
'...Why do you like the night sky, Kanako?'
'It's beautiful.'
She answered so casually.
'As simple as that.'
'I don't think about things too deeply. It's\nbeautiful, so I like it. Isn't that good enough?'
'I think that's very like you.'
'...If you overthink things too much, you might\ntrip yourself up, don't you think?'
That may have been what happened to Asa\nyesterday.
'So I like the beautiful sky, that I don't have\nto think about. I can just feel moved... and\ncomforted...'
'...That's kind of unexpected, coming from you.'
'What do you mean... You got a problem with me?'
'No, not at all...'
I guess she was just a little more of a romantic\nthan I'd thought.
'People are thinking creatures, and so they're\nmoved by things that they find themselves liking\nwithout a reason. Love is like that too.'
Love.
Just like the sky, love didn't need a reason.
'...Is there someone you love, Kanako?'
'Hm? No, I don't think so.'
'I see.'
I thought she might be able to tell me something\nthat might work as an example, but I guess not.
'But I might be able to help, just talking things\nover with you. After all, I'm a girl, and I'm\nolder than you.'
'You're worrying about girls, right?'
'Eeeh? How did you...'
'It's obvious. You and Asa and Yoru. I can tell.'
Aaah.
Apparently Kanako had figured out what I was\nworrying about.
After all, Kanako was close with both Asa and\nYoru.
'It's pretty tough to choose between them, isn't\nit?'
'I'm not exactly comparing them to each other...'
'I'm just saying as an example. I think they're\nboth cute, myself. And both important.'
'... Yeah.'
That's right.
They were both important to me, so I couldn't\nmake a decision.
'Hmm... I see.'
'Why don't you just choose, without thinking too\nhard?'
'Huh?'

'I feel like you're trying desperately to think
of a way not to hurt either of them. You're
looking for the best compromise, the correct
result.'
'But that doesn't exist. And even if it did...\nYou probably couldn't choose it.'
'So I don't think you should worry about it too\nmuch.'
'That's...'
She was right.
I'd been trying to think of how to solve this\nproblem.
But surely there was no point in thinking of it\nthat way.
That's why I should just take responsibility for\nmy own decision, and decide what I really wanted.
'How does that sound?'
'...It helps, I think.'
'The more you dither around on things like this,\nthe more it hurts. If you're a man, Aoi, then\njust go for it and settle things!'
'...You're talking like it's not your problem.'
'Well, it's not!'
She had a point.
...And maybe she was right again.
'Anyway, if things don't work out and you're in\ntrouble again, you can come talk to me again. In\nfact, I'd be happy if you did.'
'Okay?'
'...Thank you, Kanako.'
'After all, I am your senior!'
She didn't tell me what to do, or give me the\nanswer to this difficult problem.
But Kanako's words really made me feel better,\nand helped me make my decision.
She was right. It was up to me.
I had to come up with my own answer.
I had to think. And to wonder.
But just brooding wouldn't get me anywhere.
I had to really go for it.
And choose the answer that felt right to me.
